title.native: デスマーチからはじまる異世界狂想曲
title.romaji: Death March Kara Hajimaru Isekai Kyousoukyoku
title.english: Death March to the Parallel World Rhapsody

description:
The story of the light novel series and manga follows a 29-year-old programmer who is on a "death march," but one day he wakes up in another world after a nap. From a meteor shower he happens to gain vast riches, and he decides to go sightseeing. So begins his "heartwarming, occasionally serious, and harem" adventure in another world.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: โศกนาฏกรรมต่างโลกเริ่มต้นจากเดธมาร์ช
Pawai Maut Berujung Rapsodi Dunia Lain

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

node.description:
__[Website](https://wug-portal.jp/)__ | __[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/wakeupgirls/)__

__Formed:__ April 1, 2013

__Wake Up, Girls!__, otherwise known through the abbreviation WUG is a Japanese voice actress (seiyuu) collaboration signed under record label DIVE II Entertainment, which was initially made for the anime franchise [Wake Up, Girls!](https://anilist.co/anime/19023/Wake-Up-Girls/).

__Members:__
- [Mayu Yoshioka](https://anilist.co/staff/118477/Mayu-Yoshioka) (吉岡茉祐) - Member Color: Red
- [Airi Eino](https://anilist.co/staff/118471/Airi-Eino) (永野愛理) - Member Color: Indigo
- [Minami Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/118473/Minami-Tanaka) (田中美海) - Member Color: Yellow
- [Yoshino Aoyama](https://anilist.co/staff/118475/Yoshino-Aoyama) (青山吉能) - Member Color: Turquoise
- [Nanami Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/118472/Nanami-Yamashita) (山下七海) - Member Color: Purple
- [Kaya Okuno](https://anilist.co/staff/118474/Kaya-Okuno) (奥野香耶) - Member Color: Green
- [Miyu Takagi](https://anilist.co/staff/118476/Miyu-Takagi) (高木美佑) - Member Color: Orange

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wake_Up,_Girls!_(%E5%A3%B0%E5%84%AA%E3%83%A6%E3%83%8B%E3%83%83%E3%83%88), edited)

node.description: Website | Twitter | Blog (JP) __Formed:__ July 30, 2017 Biography: Run Girls, Run! (abbreviated as RGR) is an idol group created for the [Wake Up, Girls!](https://anilist.co/anime/19023) (franchise). Much like Wake Up, Girls!, the unit acts as a fictional group in the [Wake Up, Girls!](https://anilist.co/anime/19023/Wake-Up-Girls/) universe and also take part in real life idol activities. They made their first anime appearance in Wake Up, Girls! New Chapter. Run Girls, Run! was formed through the "avex x 81 Produce Wake Up, Girls! AUDITION 3rd Anisong Vocal Audition". The group made their real life debut at the Wonder Festival "WONDERFUL HOBBY LIFE FOR YOU!!26" event by singing covers of 16-Sai no Agape and Tachiagare!. Members: Hayashi Koko（林鼓子） Hayashi Koko who is born May 15, 2002 in Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan is a voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with the agency 81 Produce. She voices Hayashi Ayumi (速志歩) in the Wake Up, Girls! (franchise), starting with Wake Up, Girls! Shin Shou, which is in fact her first voice acting role. Morishima Yuka（森嶋優花） Morishima Yuka who is born March 16, 1997 in Kyoto, Japan is a voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with 81 Produce. She voices Morishima Otome (守島音芽) in the Wake Up, Girls! (franchise), starting with Wake Up, Girls! Shin Shou, which is in fact her first voice acting role as well. Atsugi Nanami（厚木那奈美） Atsugi Nanami who is born October 11, 1997 in Nagano Prefecture, Japan is a voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with 81 Produce. She voices Atsugi Itsuka (阿津木いつか) in the Wake Up, Girls! (franchise), starting with Wake Up, Girls! Shin Shou, which is in fact also her first voice acting role. (Source: rungirlsrun.jp) It was announced via Twitter on March 31, 2023 that Run Girls, Run! had disbanded.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tadanonatsu)__

Natsumi Tadano is a Japanese lyricist.

__[Artist Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/hirokawa.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayone87)__

__Keiichi Hirokawa__ is a Japanese music composer and arranger who belongs to sound production studio MONACA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HdkzTanaka)

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kobe University (Faculty of Developmental Sciences, Department of Human Representation)

__Hidekazu Tanaka__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.

He left MONACA on July 31, 2021, and went independent. 

On October 24, 2022, he was arrested on suspicion of sexual assault of a teenage girl in Meguro, Tokyo in August of that year. On March 15, 2023, Tanaka admitted to obscenity charges which included saying obscene language to a 15-year-old girl, along with admitting to voyeurism at least dozens of times in the past 10 years.

**Height:** 145 cm (4'9")
**Nicknames:** Ao-chan (あおちゃん), Kodomo sensei (こども先生, lit. Child teacher)
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)
- Renne Bright - Eiyuu Densetsu: Sen no Kiseki IV (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Hajimari no Kiseki (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Kuro no Kiseki (VG)
- Yurusen - Kamen Rider Ghost (VG)
- Fiona - Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (VG)
- Rita Rossweisse - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Moddey - Memento Mori (VG)
- Futaba Sakura - Persona 5/Royal (VG)
- Pascal - NieR: Automata (VG) (VG)
- Nian - Arknights (VG)
- Istina - Arknights (VG)
- Ravi & Apocalyptic Ravi - Epic 7 (VG)
- Schneider - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lysithea - Fire Emblem: Three Houses (VG)
- Cinderella - Nikke: Goddess of Victory (VG)
- Sugar - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)

[Profile (with line)](http://www.withline.jp/talent/?id=hiyori_kono) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/konohiyori) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kono_hiyori)

__[Artist Profile (High Kick)](https://highkick.jp/kushitamine)__

__Introduction:__
Mine Kushita, alternatively known by his birthname Yuuji Takinoue, otherwise previously known under stage name U-ZY is a Japanese composer, arranger and lyricist.

__Biography:__
He was a member of the solo vocal project Ikuta Machine, together with fellow composer and arranger Chikara Kurata (倉田主税) between 2008-2014,  until 2014 when U-ZY (which he was known as at the time) left the project. After leaving he changed his name from U-ZY to Mine Kushita, which is an anagram of Ikuta Machine.

__[Artist Profile (High Kick)](https://highkick.jp/yoshida)__

__Shiori Yoshida__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer, who is affiliated with High Kick Entertainment.

__[Artist Profile (High Kick)](https://highkick.jp/kushitamine)__

__Introduction:__
Mine Kushita, alternatively known by his birthname Yuuji Takinoue, otherwise previously known under stage name U-ZY is a Japanese composer, arranger and lyricist.

__Biography:__
He was a member of the solo vocal project Ikuta Machine, together with fellow composer and arranger Chikara Kurata (倉田主税) between 2008-2014,  until 2014 when U-ZY (which he was known as at the time) left the project. After leaving he changed his name from U-ZY to Mine Kushita, which is an anagram of Ikuta Machine.

__Hometown:__ Winterthur, Switzerland
